medical_history.chief_complaint: Failure to thrive and excessive thirst (polydipsia) in a 2-year-old boy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in early infancy, with weight gain deceleration from age 9 months and length retardation from 18 months. The boy was drinking 4 liters of fluid per day, which led to a calorie intake shortage and was treated successfully with DDAVP, resulting in normal weight gain within 3 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Familial neurohypophysial diabetes insipidus (FNDI) confirmed through genetic testing in affected family members, with the presence of NP85C 3G mutation.
medical_history.family_history: Multiple family members have reported symptoms of polyuria and polydipsia, with an autosomal dominant inheritance pattern for FNDI.
